intro: Bignonia brachypoda var. heterophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf crossvine, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive, narrow leaves and clusters of yellow-orange tubular flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant is a vigorous climber with a woody stem and can reach lengths of several meters. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and wildlife habitat.
